member.name: T:Opc.Ua.EncodeableFactory
member.summary: Creates encodeable objects based on the type id.

remarks.para: This factory is used to store and retrieve underlying OPC UA system types.
You can manually add types. You can also import all types from a specified assembly. Once the types exist within the factory, these types can be then easily queried.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.EncodeableFactory.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a factory initialized with the types in the core library.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.EncodeableFactory.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a factory which is marked as shared and initialized with the types in the core library.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.EncodeableFactory.#ctor(Opc.Ua.EncodeableFactory)
member.summary: Creates a factory by copying the table from another factory.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.EncodeableFactory.AddEncodeableTypes(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the types from an assembly.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.EncodeableFactory.GetXmlName(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the xml qualified name for the specified system type id.
member.remarks: Returns the xml qualified name for the specified system type id.
member.param: The underlying type to query and return the Xml qualified name of

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.EncodeableFactory.AddEncodeableType(System.Type)
member.summary: Adds an extension type to the factory.
member.remarks: Adds an extension type to the factory.
member.param: The underlying system type to add to the factory

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.EncodeableFactory.AddEncodeableType(Opc.Ua.ExpandedNodeId,System.Type)
member.summary: Associates an encodeable type with an encoding id.
member.param: A NodeId for a Data Type Encoding node
The system type to use for the specified encoding.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.EncodeableFactory.AddEncodeableTypes(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Adds all encodable types exported from an assembly to the factory.

remarks.para: Adds all encodable types exported from an assembly to the factory.
This method uses reflection on the specified assembly to export all of the types the assembly exposes, and automatically adds all types that implement the interface, to the factory.

member.param: The assembly containing the types to add to the factory

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.EncodeableFactory.GetSystemType(Opc.Ua.ExpandedNodeId)
member.summary: Returns the system type for the specified type id.
member.remarks: Returns the system type for the specified type id.
member.param: The type id to return the system-type of

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.EncodeableFactory.GlobalFactory
member.summary: The default factory for the process.
member.remarks: The default factory for the process.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.EncodeableFactory.SyncRoot
member.summary: Returns the object used to synchronize access to the factory.
member.remarks: Returns the object used to synchronize access to the factory.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.EncodeableFactory.InstanceId
member.summary: Returns a unique identifier for the table instance. Used to debug problems with shared tables.

member.summary: This class contains functions used to evaluate a ContentFilter and report the results of the evaluation.
A description for the ContentFilter DataType.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.ContentFilter.Evaluate(Opc.Ua.FilterContext,Opc.Ua.IFilterTarget)
member.summary: Evaluates the first element in the ContentFilter. If the first or any subsequent element has dependent elements, the dependent elements are evaluated before the root element (recursive descent). Elements which are not linked (directly or indirectly) to the first element will not be evaluated (they have no influence on the result).
member.param: The context to use when evaluating the filter.
The target to use when evaluating elements that reference the type model.
member.returns: Returns true, false or null.

member.summary: Evaluates element at the specified index.

member.summary: Populates a list with the non-child related references that belong to the node.

The list of references to populate.
member.remarks:
This method only returns references that are not implied by the parent-child relation or references which are intrinsic to the NodeState classes (e.g. HasTypeDefinition)
This method also only returns the reference that are in memory and does not attempt to access an underlying system. The PopulateBrowser method is used to discover those references.

member.returns: The child.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Bindings.TcpChannel.Sign(System.ArraySegment{System.Byte},System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2)
member.summary: Adds an asymmetric signature to the end of the buffer.
member.remarks: Start and count specify the block of data to be signed. The padding and signature must be written to the stream wrapped by the encoder.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Bindings.TcpChannel.Verify(System.ArraySegment{System.Byte},System.Byte[],System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2)
member.summary: Verifies an asymmetric signature at the end of the buffer.
member.remarks: Start and count specify the block of data including the signature and padding. The current security policy uri and sender certificate specify the size of the signature. This call also verifies that the padding is correct.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Bindings.TcpChannel.Encrypt(System.ArraySegment{System.Byte},System.ArraySegment{System.Byte},System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2)
member.summary: Encrypts the buffer using asymmetric encryption.
member.remarks: Start and count specify the block of data to be encrypted. The caller must ensure that count is a multiple of the input block size for the current cipher. The header specifies unencrypted data that must be copied to the output.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Bindings.TcpChannel.Decrypt(System.ArraySegment{System.Byte},System.ArraySegment{System.Byte},System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2)
member.summary: Decrypts the buffer using asymmetric encryption.
member.remarks: Start and count specify the block of data to be decrypted. The header specifies unencrypted data that must be copied to the output.

member.name: T:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes
member.summary: A class that defines constants used by UA applications.
A class that defines constants used by UA applications.
Defines standard status codes.
member.remarks: Defines standard status codes.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadUnexpectedError
member.summary: An unexpected error occurred.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadInternalError
member.summary: An internal error occurred as a result of a programming or configuration error.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadOutOfMemory
member.summary: Not enough memory to complete the operation.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadResourceUnavailable
member.summary: An operating system resource is not available.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadCommunicationError
member.summary: A low level communication error occurred.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadEncodingError
member.summary: Encoding halted because of invalid data in the objects being serialized.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadDecodingError
member.summary: Decoding halted because of invalid data in the stream.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadEncodingLimitsExceeded
member.summary: The message encoding/decoding limits imposed by the stack have been exceeded.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadRequestTooLarge
member.summary: The request message size exceeds limits set by the server.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadResponseTooLarge
member.summary: The response message size exceeds limits set by the client.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadUnknownResponse
member.summary: An unrecognized response was received from the server.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadTimeout
member.summary: The operation timed out.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadServiceUnsupported
member.summary: The server does not support the requested service.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadShutdown
member.summary: The operation was cancelled because the application is shutting down.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadServerNotConnected
member.summary: The operation could not complete because the client is not connected to the server.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadServerHalted
member.summary: The server has stopped and cannot process any requests.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadNothingToDo
member.summary: There was nothing to do because the client passed a list of operations with no elements.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadTooManyOperations
member.summary: The request could not be processed because it specified too many operations.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadTooManyMonitoredItems
member.summary: The request could not be processed because there are too many monitored items in the subscription.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadDataTypeIdUnknown
member.summary: The extension object cannot be (de)serialized because the data type id is not recognized.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadCertificateInvalid
member.summary: The certificate provided as a parameter is not valid.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadSecurityChecksFailed
member.summary: An error occurred verifying security.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadCertificateTimeInvalid
member.summary: The Certificate has expired or is not yet valid.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadCertificateIssuerTimeInvalid
member.summary: An Issuer Certificate has expired or is not yet valid.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadCertificateHostNameInvalid
member.summary: The HostName used to connect to a Server does not match a HostName in the Certificate.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadCertificateUriInvalid
member.summary: The URI specified in the ApplicationDescription does not match the URI in the Certificate.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadCertificateUseNotAllowed
member.summary: The Certificate may not be used for the requested operation.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadCertificateIssuerUseNotAllowed
member.summary: The Issuer Certificate may not be used for the requested operation.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadCertificateUntrusted
member.summary: The Certificate is not trusted.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadCertificateRevocationUnknown
member.summary: It was not possible to determine if the Certificate has been revoked.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadCertificateIssuerRevocationUnknown
member.summary: It was not possible to determine if the Issuer Certificate has been revoked.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadCertificateRevoked
member.summary: The Certificate has been revoked.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadCertificateIssuerRevoked
member.summary: The Issuer Certificate has been revoked.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadUserAccessDenied
member.summary: User does not have permission to perform the requested operation.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadIdentityTokenInvalid
member.summary: The user identity token is not valid.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadIdentityTokenRejected
member.summary: The user identity token is valid but the server has rejected it.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadSecureChannelIdInvalid
member.summary: The specified secure channel is not longer valid.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadInvalidTimestamp
member.summary: The timestamp is outside the range allowed by the server.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadNonceInvalid
member.summary: The nonce does appear to be not a random value or it is not the correct length.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadSessionIdInvalid
member.summary: The session id is not valid.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadSessionClosed
member.summary: The session was closed by the client.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadSessionNotActivated
member.summary: The session cannot be used because ActivateSession has not been called.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadSubscriptionIdInvalid
member.summary: The subscription id is not valid.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadRequestHeaderInvalid
member.summary: The header for the request is missing or invalid.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadTimestampsToReturnInvalid
member.summary: The timestamps to return parameter is invalid.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadRequestCancelledByClient
member.summary: The request was cancelled by the client.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.GoodSubscriptionTransferred
member.summary: The subscription was transferred to another session.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.GoodCompletesAsynchronously
member.summary: The processing will complete asynchronously.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.GoodOverload
member.summary: Sampling has slowed down due to resource limitations.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.GoodClamped
member.summary: The value written was accepted but was clamped.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadNoCommunication
member.summary: Communication with the data source is defined, but not established, and there is no last known value available.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadWaitingForInitialData
member.summary: Waiting for the server to obtain values from the underlying data source.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadNodeIdInvalid
member.summary: The syntax of the node id is not valid.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadNodeIdUnknown
member.summary: The node id refers to a node that does not exist in the server address space.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadAttributeIdInvalid
member.summary: The attribute is not supported for the specified Node.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadIndexRangeInvalid
member.summary: The syntax of the index range parameter is invalid.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadIndexRangeNoData
member.summary: No data exists within the range of indexes specified.

member.name: F:Opc.Ua.StatusCodes.BadDataEncodingInvalid

members.member:
A wrapper for a GUID used during object serialization.
This class provides a wrapper around the object, allowing it to be serialized and encoded/decoded to/from an underlying stream. x

member.name: T:Opc.Ua.DataValue

remarks.para: This object relates to the OPC UA Specifications Part 6: Mappings, section 6.2.2.16 titled DataValue.

This object is essentially a place-holder for the following:
for the Servers Timestamp

example.code: 'define a new DataValue first where: ' (a) the value is a string, which is "abc123" ' (b) the statuscode is 0 (zero) ' (c) the timestamp is 'now' Dim dv As DataValue = New DataValue(New Variant("abc123"), New StatusCode(0), DateTime.Now);

member.name: T:Opc.Ua.ExtensionObject
member.summary: An object used to wrap data types that the receiver may not understand.

remarks.para: This class is a wrapper/helper class for storing data types that a receiver might not understand, or be prepared to handle. This class may use to analyze an object and retrieve the values of its public properties directly, and then encode those into a string representation that can then be easily encoded as a single string.

An instance of the is a container for any complex data types which cannot be encoded as one of the other built-in data types. The ExtensionObject contains a complex value serialized as a sequence of bytes or as an XML element. It also contains an identifier which indicates what data it contains and how it is encoded.

example.para: The following example demonstrates a simple class containing 3 public properties of type int, DateTime and string. This class implements the interface, and is then encoded using the WriteExtensionObject method.
example.code:
'First, we will define a very simple class object that will represent 'some real-world process.
Class simpleClass Inherits IEncodeable
'fields Public PublicFieldNotVisible As String = "I should not be encoded"
'properties Private stringField As String Private intField As Integer Private datetimeField As DateTime
'class constructor Public Sub New(ByVal StringValue As String, ByVal IntValue As Integer, ByVal DateTimeValue As DateTime) StringProperty = StringValue IntProperty = IntValue DatetimeProperty = DateTimeValue End Sub
Public Sub New(ByVal SimpleClassInstance As simpleClass) StringProperty = SimpleClassInstance.StringProperty IntProperty = SimpleClassInstance.IntProperty DatetimeProperty = SimpleClassInstance.DatetimeProperty End Sub
Public Property StringProperty As String Get Return stringField End Get Set stringField = value End Set End Property
Public Property IntProperty As Integer Get Return intField End Get Set intField = value End Set End Property
Public Property DatetimeProperty As DateTime Get Return datetimeField End Get Set datetimeField = value End Set End Property
Public ReadOnly Property TypeId As ExpandedNodeId Get Return New ExpandedNodeId(Guid.NewGuid) End Get End Property
Public Sub Encode(ByVal encoder As IEncoder) If encoder Isnot Nothing Then 'our simple object has 3 properies: string, int and datetime encoder.WriteString("StringProperty", Me.StringProperty) encoder.WriteInt32("IntProperty", Me.IntProperty) encoder.WriteDateTime("DateTimeProperty", Me.DatetimeProperty) End If End Sub
Public Sub Decode(ByVal decoder As IDecoder) If decoder Isnot Nothing Then Me.StringProperty = decoder.ReadString("StringProperty") Me.IntProperty = decoder.ReadInt16("IntProperty") Me.DatetimeProperty = decoder.ReadDateTime("DateTimeProperty") End If End Sub
Public Function IsEqual(ByVal encodeable As IEncodeable) As Boolean Return encodeable.Equals(Me) End Function
Public Function Clone() As Object Return New simpleClass(Me) End Function End Class
Public Sub nodeid() 'define an instance of our class object, defined above. Dim mySimpleClassInstance1 As simpleClass = New simpleClass("String", int.MaxValue, DateTime.Now)
'define an object that will encapsulate/extend our simple instance above Dim extendedSimpleClassInstance As ExtensionObject = New ExtensionObject(mySimpleClassInstance1)
'encode our class object into the stream uaEncoderInstance.WriteExtensionObject("Extended1", extendedSimpleClassInstance) End Sub

member.name: T:Opc.Ua.StatusCode
member.summary: A numeric code that describes the result of a service or operation.

remarks.para: The StatusCode is defined in OPC UA Specifications Part 4: Services, section 7.22 titled StatusCode.
A numeric code that is used to describe the result of a service or operation. The StatusCode uses bit-assignments, which are described below.

The StatusCode is a 32-bit number, with the top 16-bits (high word) representing the numeric value of an error or condition, whereas the bottom 16-bits (low word) represents additional flags to provide more information on the meaning of the status code.

The following list shows the bit-assignments, i.e. 0-7 means bit 0 to bit 7.
0 - 7:
InfoBits. Additional information bits that qualify the status code.
8 - 9:
The type of information contained in the info bits. These bits have the following meanings:
Binary Representation 00:
The info bits are not used and must be set to zero.
Binary Representation 01:
The status code and its info bits are associated with a data value returned from the Server.
Binary Representation 10 or 11:
Reserved for future use. The info bits must be ignored.
10 - 13:
Reserved for future use. Must always be zero.
14: Indicates that the semantics of the associated data value have changed. Clients should not process the data value until they re-read the metadata associated with the Variable. Servers should set this bit if the metadata has changed in way that could case application errors if the Client does not re-read the metadata. For example, a change to the engineering units could create problems if the Client uses the value to perform calculations. [UA Part 8] defines the conditions where a Server must set this bit for a DA Variable. Other specifications may define additional conditions. A Server may define other conditions that cause this bit to be set. This bit only has meaning for status codes returned as part of a data change Notification. Status codes used in other contexts must always set this bit to zero.
15:
Indicates that the structure of the associated data value has changed since the last Notification. Clients should not process the data value unless they re-read the metadata. Servers must set this bit if the DataTypeEncoding used for a Variable changes. Clause 7.14 describes how the DataTypeEncoding is specified for a Variable. The bit is also set if the data type Attribute of the Variable changes. A Variable with data type BaseDataType does not require the bit to be set when the data type changes. Servers must also set this bit if the length of a fixed length array Variable changes. This bit is provided to warn Clients that parse complex data values that their parsing routines could fail because the serialized form of the data value has changed. This bit only has meaning for status codes returned as part of a data change Notification. Status codes used in other contexts must always set this bit to zero.
16 - 27:
The code is a numeric value assigned to represent different conditions. Each code has a symbolic name and a numeric value. All descriptions in the UA specification refer to the symbolic name. [UA Part 6] maps the symbolic names onto a numeric value.
28 - 29:
Reserved for future use. Must always be zero.
30 - 31:
Indicates whether the status code represents a good, bad or uncertain condition. These bits have the following meanings:
Binary Represntation 00:
Indicates that the operation was successful and the associated results may be used.
Binary Represntation 01:
Indicates that the operation was partially successful and that associated results may not be suitable for some purposes.
Binary Represntation 10:
Indicates that the operation failed and any associated results cannot be used.
Binary Represntation 11:
Reserved for future use. All Clients should treat a status code with this severity as Bad.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.BaseVariableState.ArrayDimensions
member.summary: The number of dimensions for an array values with one or more fixed dimensions.
member.remarks: If the Value Rank does not identify an array of a specific dimension (i.e. ValueRank <= 0) the Array Dimensions attribute can either be set to null or the attribute is missing. This behaviour is vendor-specific. If the Value Rank attribute specifies an array of a specific dimension (i.e. ValueRank > 0) then the Array Dimensions attribute shall be specified in the table defining the Variable.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.ServerRegistration.AlternateDiscoveryUrls
member.summary: Gets or sets the alternate discovery urls.
member.remarks:
These addresses are used to specify alternate paths to ther via firewalls, proxies or similar network infrastructure. If these paths are specified in the configuration file then the server will use the domain of the URL used by the client to determine which, if any, or the alternate addresses to use instead of the primary addresses.
In the ideal world the server would provide these URLs during registration but this table allows the administrator to provide the information to the disovery server directly without requiring a patch to the server.

member.name: T:Opc.Ua.CertificateTrustList
member.summary: A list of trusted certificates.
member.remarks:
Administrators can create a list of trusted certificates by designating all certificates in a particular certificate store as trusted and/or by explictly specifying a list of individual certificates.
A trust list can contain either instance certificates or certification authority certificates. If the list contains instance certificates the application will trust peers that use the instance certificate (provided the ApplicationUri and HostName match the certificate).
If the list contains certification authority certificates then the application will trust peers that have certificates issued by one of the authorities.
Any certificate could be revoked by the issuer (CAs may issue certificates for other CAs). The RevocationMode specifies whether this check should be done each time a certificate in the list are used.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.CertificateIdentifier.SubjectName
member.summary: The certificate's subject name - the distinguished name of an X509 certificate.
member.value: The distinguished name of an X509 certificate acording to the Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1) syntax.
member.remarks:
The subject field identifies the entity associated with the public key stored in the subject public key field. The subject name MAY be carried in the subject field and/or the subjectAltName extension. Where it is non-empty, the subject field MUST contain an X.500 distinguished name (DN). Name is defined by the following ASN.1 structures: Name ::= CHOICE {RDNSequence } RDNSequence ::= SEQUENCE OF RelativeDistinguishedName RelativeDistinguishedName ::= SET OF AttributeTypeAndValue AttributeTypeAndValue ::= SEQUENCE {type AttributeType, value AttributeValue } AttributeType ::= OBJECT IDENTIFIER AttributeValue ::= ANY DEFINED BY AttributeType DirectoryString ::= CHOICE { teletexString TeletexString (SIZE (1..MAX)), printableString PrintableString (SIZE (1..MAX)), universalString UniversalString (SIZE (1..MAX)), utf8String UTF8String (SIZE (1..MAX)), bmpString BMPString (SIZE (1..MAX)) } The Name describes a hierarchical name composed of attributes, such as country name, and corresponding values, such as US. The type of the component AttributeValue is determined by the AttributeType; in general it will be a DirectoryString. String X.500 AttributeType:
CN commonName
L localityName
ST stateOrProvinceName
O organizationName
OU organizationalUnitName
C countryName
STREET streetAddress
DC domainComponent
UID userid
This notation is designed to be convenient for common forms of name. This section gives a few examples of distinguished names written using this notation. First is a name containing three relative distinguished names (RDNs): CN=Steve Kille,O=Isode Limited,C=GB
RFC 3280 Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure, April 2002 RFC 2253 LADPv3 Distinguished Names, December 1997

member.name: T:Opc.Ua.NodeId
member.summary: Stores an identifier for a node in a server's address space.

remarks.para:
Please refer to OPC Specifications:
Address Space Model setion 7.2
Address Space Model setion 5.2.2
Stores the id of a Node, which resides within the server's address space.

The NodeId can be either:
[]
remarks.note: Important: Keep in mind that the actual ID's of nodes should be unique such that no two nodes within an address-space share the same ID's.
remarks.para: The NodeId can be assigned to a particular namespace index. This index is merely just a number and does not represent some index within a collection that this node has any knowledge of. The assumption is that the host of this object will manage that directly.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.NodeId.op_Implicit(System.UInt32)~Opc.Ua.NodeId
member.summary: Converts an integer to a numeric node identifier.
member.remarks: Converts an integer to a numeric node identifier for comparissons.

example.code:
'create some variables Dim id1 As UInt = 100 Dim id2 As UInt = 102 Dim node1 As NodeId
'create our node node1 = new NodeId(id1)
'now to compare the node to the ids using a simple comparisson and Equals: Utils.Trace("Comparing NodeId to uint") Utils.Trace( String.Format(" Comparing 100 to 100 = [equals] {0}", node1.Equals(id1)) ) Utils.Trace( String.Format(" Comparing 100 to 100 = [ = ] {0}", node1 = id1) ) Utils.Trace( String.Format(" Comparing 100 to 101 = [equals] {0}", node1.Equals(id2)) ) Utils.Trace( String.Format(" Comparing 100 to 101 = [ = ] {0}", node1 = id2) )
example.para: This produces the following output (taken from C# example):

Comparing NodeId to uint
Comparing 100 to 100 = [equals] True
Comparing 100 to 100 = [ == ] True
Comparing 100 to 101 = [equals] False
Comparing 100 to 101 = [ == ] False

member.param: The to compare this node to.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.NodeId.op_Implicit(System.Guid)~Opc.Ua.NodeId
member.summary: Converts a guid to a guid node identifier.
member.remarks: Converts a NodeId into a Guid allowing you to compare a Node against a Guid.

example.para: This produces the following output (taken from C# example):

Comparing NodeId to GUID
Comparing bbe8b5f2-0f50-4302-877f-346afb07704c to bbe8b5f2-0f50-4302-877f-346afb07704c = [equals] True
Comparing bbe8b5f2-0f50-4302-877f-346afb07704c to bbe8b5f2-0f50-4302-877f-346afb07704c = [ = ] True
Comparing bbe8b5f2-0f50-4302-877f-346afb07704c to e707de86-4c11-4fe6-94b2-83638a9427e6 = [equals] False
Comparing bbe8b5f2-0f50-4302-877f-346afb07704c to e707de86-4c11-4fe6-94b2-83638a9427e6 = [ = ] False

member.param: The to compare this node to.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.NodeId.op_Implicit(System.Byte[])~Opc.Ua.NodeId
member.summary: Converts a byte array to an opaque node identifier.
member.remarks: This operator allows you to compare a NodeId to an array of Bytes.

example.code:
'define our 2 Byte[] ids, and then define our node to use the first id. Dim id1 As Byte() = New Byte() { 65, 66, 67, 68, 69 } Dim id2 As Byte() = New Byte() { 97, 98, 99, 100, 101 } Dim node1 As NodeId = New NodeId(id1)
'convert our bytes to string so we can display them Dim id1String As String = System.Text.ASCIIEncoding.ASCII.GetString(id1) Dim id2String As String = System.Text.ASCIIEncoding.ASCII.GetString(id2)
'now to compare the node to the guids Utils.Trace("Comparing NodeId to Byte()") Utils.Trace( String.Format("Comparing {0} to {0} = [equals] {2}", id1String, id1String, node1.Equals(id1)) ) Utils.Trace( String.Format("Comparing {0} to {0} = [ = ] {2}", id1String, id1String, node1 = id1) ) Utils.Trace( String.Format("Comparing {0} to {1} = [equals] {2}", id1String, id2String, node1.Equals(id2)) ) Utils.Trace( String.Format("Comparing {0} to {1} = [ = ] {2}", id1String, id2String, node1 = id2) )
example.para: This produces the following output (taken from C# example):
Comparing NodeId to Byte[] Comparing ABCDE to ABCDE = [equals] True Comparing ABCDE to ABCDE = [ == ] True Comparing ABCDE to abcde = [equals] False Comparing ABCDE to abcde = [ == ] False

member.param: The [] array to compare this node to

NodeId = "hello123"

This would translate into:
ns=1;s=hello123

member.name: T:Opc.Ua.TransportChannelSettings
member.summary: Stores the configuration settings for a channel.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.TransportChannelSettings.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description for the endpoint.
member.remarks: May be null if no security is used.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.TransportChannelSettings.Configuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the configuration for the endpoint.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.TransportChannelSettings.ClientCertificate
member.summary: Gets or sets the client certificate.
member.remarks: May be null if no security is used.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.TransportChannelSettings.ServerCertificate
member.summary: Gets or sets the server certificate.
member.remarks: May be null if no security is used.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.TransportChannelSettings.CertificateValidator
member.summary: Gets or sets the certificate validator.
member.remarks: May be null if no security is used. This is the object used by the channel to validate received certificates. Validatation errors are reported to the application via this object.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.TransportChannelSettings.NamespaceUris
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to the table of namespaces for the server.
member.remarks: This is a thread safe object that may be updated by the application at any time. This table is used to lookup the NamespaceURI for the DataTypeEncodingId when decoding ExtensionObjects. If the NamespaceURI can be found the decoder will use the Factory to create an instance of a .NET object. The raw data is passed to application if the NamespaceURI cannot be found or there is no .NET class associated with the DataTypeEncodingId then.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.TransportChannelSettings.Factory
member.summary: Gets or sets the table of known encodeable objects.
member.remarks: This is a thread safe object that may be updated by the application at any time. This is a table of .NET types indexed by their DataTypeEncodingId. The decoder uses this table to automatically create the appropriate .NET objects when it encounters an ExtensionObject in the message being decoded. The table uses DataTypeEncodingIds with the URI explicitly specified so multiple channels with different servers can share the same table. The NamespaceUris table is used to lookup the NamespaceURI from the NamespaceIndex provide in the encoded message.

member.summary: Gets or sets the descriptions for the endpoints supported by the listener.

member.summary: Gets or sets the configuration for the endpoints.

member.summary: Gets or sets the server certificate.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.TransportListenerSettings.CertificateValidator
member.summary: Gets or sets the certificate validator.
member.remarks: This is the object used by the channel to validate received certificates. Validatation errors are reported to the application via this object.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.TransportListenerSettings.NamespaceUris
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to the table of namespaces for the server.
member.remarks: This is a thread safe object that may be updated by the application at any time. This table is used to lookup the NamespaceURI for the DataTypeEncodingId when decoding ExtensionObjects. If the NamespaceURI can be found the decoder will use the Factory to create an instance of a .NET object. The raw data is passed to application if the NamespaceURI cannot be found or there is no .NET class associated with the DataTypeEncodingId then.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.TransportListenerSettings.Factory
member.summary: Gets or sets the table of known encodeable objects.
member.remarks: This is a thread safe object that may be updated by the application at any time. This is a table of .NET types indexed by their DataTypeEncodingId. The decoder uses this table to automatically create the appropriate .NET objects when it encounters an ExtensionObject in the message being decoded. The table uses DataTypeEncodingIds with the URI explicitly specified so multiple channels with different servers can share the same table. The NamespaceUris table is used to lookup the NamespaceURI from the NamespaceIndex provide in the encoded message.

member.name: T:Opc.Ua.LocalizedText
member.summary: Human readable qualified with a locale.

remarks.para: The LocalizedText is defined in Part 3 - Address Space Model, Section 7.5, titled LocalizedText.
This class provides a wrapper for posting text that is qualified with the locale that it is intended for.

example.para: The following example shows a very simple use of this class to localize a welcome message
example.code:
Dim welcomeUS As LocalizedText = New LocalizedText( "Hi Everyone", "EN-GB" ) Dim welcomeGB As LocalizedText = New LocalizedText( "Hello Everyone", "EN-GB" ) Dim welcomeNoLocale As LocalizedText = New LocalizedText( "Welcome" )
Utils.Trace( welcomeUS.ToString() ) Utils.Trace( welcomeGB.ToString() ) Utils.Trace( welcomeNoLocale.ToString() )
example.para:
This produces the following output:
[EN-US]:Hi Everyone
[EN-GB]:Hello Everyone
Welcome

member.name: T:Opc.Ua.WindowsCertificateStore
member.summary: Provides access to a simple file based certificate store.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.WindowsCertificateStore.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a store.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.WindowsCertificateStore.Dispose
member.summary: May be called by the application to clean up resources.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.WindowsCertificateStore.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Cleans up all resources held by the object.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.WindowsCertificateStore.Open(System.String)
member.remarks:
Syntax (items enclosed in [] are optional):
[\\HostName\]StoreType[\(ServiceName | UserSid)]\SymbolicName
HostName - the name of the machine where the store resides. SymbolicName - one of LocalMachine, CurrentUser, User or Service ServiceName - the name of an NT service. UserSid - the SID for a user account. SymbolicName - the symbolic name of the store (e.g. My, Root, Trust, CA, etc.).
Examples:
\\MYPC\LocalMachine\My CurrentUser\Trust \\MYPC\Service\My UA Server\UA Applications User\S-1-5-25\Root

member.name: T:Opc.Ua.QualifiedName
member.summary: A name qualified with a namespace.

remarks.para: The QualifiedName is defined in Part 3 - Address Space Model, Section 7.3, titled Qualified Name.
The QualifiedName is a simple wrapper class that is used to generate a fully-qualified name for any type that has a name.

A Fully Qualified name is one that consists of a name, and an index of which namespace (within a namespace table) this name belongs to. For example
Namespace Index = 1
Name = MyName
becomes:
1:MyName

member.summary: The default constructor.

member.summary: Updates the validator with a new set of trust lists.

member.summary: Updates the validator with the current state of the configuration.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.CertificateValidator.Validate(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2)
member.summary: Validates a certificate.
member.remarks:
Each UA application may have a list of trusted certificates that is different from all other UA applications that may be running on the same machine. As a result, the certificate validator cannot rely completely on the Windows certificate store and user or machine specific CTLs (certificate trust lists).
The validator constructs the trust chain for the certificate and follows the chain until it finds a certification that is in the application trust list. Non-fatal trust chain errors (i.e. certificate expired) are ignored if the certificate is in the application trust list.
If no certificate in the chain is trusted then the validator will still accept the certification if there are no trust chain errors.
The validator may be configured to ignore the application trust list and/or trust chain.

member.summary: Saves the certificate in the invalid certificate directory.

member.summary: Returns the certificate information for a trusted peer certificate.

member.summary: Returns the authority key identifier in the certificate.

member.name: T:Opc.Ua.Variant
member.summary: A structure that could contain value with any of the UA built-in data types.

remarks.para: The Variant is described in Part 6 - Mappings, Section 6.2.2.15, titled Variant
Variant is a data type in COM, but not within the .NET Framework. Therefore OPC UA has its own Variant type that supports all of the OPC UA data-types.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.ExpandedNodeId.Format
member.summary: Formats a expanded node id as a string.

remarks.para: Formats a ExpandedNodeId as a string.
An example of this would be:

NodeId = "hello123"
NamespaceUri = "http://mycompany/"
This would translate into:
nsu=http://mycompany/;str=hello123
